content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: --STRTPT
      operator: exists
    - name: --STTPT
      operator: not_exists
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SDTMIG.CG0062
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Raise an error when --STRTPT is present in dataset and --STTPT is not
  present in dataset.
Outcome:
  Message: --STRTPT is present in dataset, but --STTPT is not present in dataset.
  Output Variables:
    - --STRTPT
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Dataset
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0062
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: The description or date and/or time of a time point
                  that acts as a fixed reference  for characterizing the start of
                  an observation. This is the sponsor-defined reference  point referred
                  to by --STRTPT.
                Document: Model v2.0
                Item: --STTPT
                Section: Timing
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.3'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0062
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 or other character
                  format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by --STRTPT.
                  Examples; "2003-12-15" or "VISIT 1".
                Document: Model v1.7
                Item: Table 2.2.5.1 --STTPT
                Section: 2.2.5 Timing Variables for All Classes
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.2'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0062
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: (--STTPT) Description or date/time in ISO 8601 or
                  other character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred
                  to by --STRTPT. Examples; "2003-12-15" or "VISIT 1".
                Document: Model v1.4
                Item: Specification
                Section: 2.2.5 Timing Variables for All Classes
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - ALL
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ALL

json.Description: Raise an error when --STRTPT is present in dataset and --STTPT is not present in dataset.

Outcome.Message: --STRTPT is present in dataset, but --STTPT is not present in dataset.

Citations.Cited_Guidance: The description or date and/or time of a time point that acts as a fixed reference  for characterizing the start of an observation. This is the sponsor-defined reference  point referred to by --STRTPT.
Description or date/time in ISO 8601 or other character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by --STRTPT. Examples; "2003-12-15" or "VISIT 1".
(--STTPT) Description or date/time in ISO 8601 or other character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by --STRTPT. Examples; "2003-12-15" or "VISIT 1".
